thread.title: Ajax woman accused of trying to drown three-year-old son
thread.title_full: Ajax woman accused of trying to drown three-year-old son | CTV Toronto News

author: Rachael D'Amore and Kayla Goodfield, CTV Toronto
title: Ajax woman accused of trying to drown three-year-old son
text:
An Ajax woman has been charged with attempted murder after she allegedly tried to drown her three-year-old son.
According to police, a passerby spotted a woman holding a small child on the railing of a bridge near Rotary Park at around 4 p.m. on Thursday.
The witness, who told police that the woman was “acting strangely,” said she started up a conversation with the woman and walked with her and the child toward the parking lot.
At some point, the woman parted ways with the witness and headed toward the beach area of the park.
A second passerby told police that they saw the woman holding the child under the water.
Durham Regional Police officer Dave Selby told CTV News Toronto that the second witness described the mother’s actions as “odd.”
“The citizen was just concerned a child that young being perched on the rail overtop of moving water and it’s very cold out,” he said.
The bystander then walked with the mother and the child off of the bridge, but afterwards noticed they were heading towards the beach. It is alleged that the woman was then seen standing in water up to her thighs while holding her child underwater.
Selby said the witness then yelled at her and she then lifted the child out of the water. The witness was then able to get into the water and help both of them get to shore.
The witnesses wrapped the boy in warm clothing until police and EMS arrived at the scene to transport him to hospital.
Selby said Durham police “tip their hats” to the Good Samaritans who stepped in and helped.
“Here’s two complete strangers that decided to get involved because something didn’t look right,” Selby said. “That was fantastic what they did.”
Speaking with CTV News Toronto, area resident Ann Buffett said she hopes she would react the same way in such a situation.
“When you see something like that you don’t know what’s going on, it may take you a few second to realize the child’s in danger, but I’m sure I would’ve jumped in and done it,” she said.
The boy was treated for unknown injuries and later released to the care of his father.
Initially, police arrested the woman under the provisions of the Mental Health Act but later charged her upon her release.
A suspect identified as a 29-year-old Ajax woman has been charged with attempted murder, aggravated assault and failure to provide the necessaries of life.
Police did not provide the suspect’s name in order to protect the identity of the child.
They urge anyone who was in the area at the time or anyone who may have new information about the incident to call them at 1-888-579-1520, ext. 5234.
